solution_line_template: If you answer every question correctly in the test, the total possible marks are {num_questions}*{marks_per_question}= <<{num_questions}*{marks_per_question}={total_possible_marks}>>{total_possible_marks} marks.
If Jose got five questions wrong, he lost {jose_wrong}*{marks_per_question} = <<{jose_wrong}*{marks_per_question}={jose_marks_lost}>>{jose_marks_lost} marks because each question has two marks.
Therefore, Jose scored {total_possible_marks}-{jose_marks_lost} = <<{total_possible_marks}-{jose_marks_lost}={jose_score}>>{jose_score} marks on the test.

Meghan scored {meghan_less_than_jose} marks less than that which Jose got, a total of {jose_score}-{meghan_less_than_jose} = <<{jose_score}-{meghan_less_than_jose}={meghan_score}>>{meghan_score} marks.
The total marks that Jose and Meghan scored in the test are {meghan_score}+{jose_score} = <<{meghan_score}+{jose_score}={jose_meghan_total}>>{jose_meghan_total}

Alisson scored {jose_score}-{alisson_less_than_jose} = <<{jose_score}-{alisson_less_than_jose}={alisson_score}>>{alisson_score} marks in the examination, {alisson_less_than_jose} marks less than that which Jose scored on the test.
The total number of marks that the three scored in the test is {jose_meghan_total}+{alisson_score} = <<{jose_meghan_total}+{alisson_score}={answer}>>{answer}
